list.title: addfonts
list.description: The addonts function allows add font to the document from an url

list.title: blur
list.description: The blur function allows to create a svg blur filter.

list.title: box
list.description: The box function allows to add a box legend on a map

list.title: centroid
list.description: Calculate the centroid of all the geometries given in a GeoJSON FeatureCollection

list.title: choro
list.description: This function discretizes an array of numbers

list.title: choro_horizontal
list.description: The choro_horizontal function allows to add an horizontal legend on a map for choropleth layers

list.title: choro_vertical
list.description: The choro_vertical function allows to add a vertical legend on a map for choropleth layers

list.title: circle
list.description: The circle function allows to create a layer with circles from a geoJSON

list.title: circles
list.description: The circles function allows to add an legend for proportional circles

list.title: circles_half
list.description: The mushrooms function allows to add an legend for mushroom maps

list.title: circles_nested
list.description: The circles_nested function allows to add an legend for proportional circles

list.title: clipPath
list.description: The clipPath function allows to create a clip layer. WARNING - the clip is valid for the entireweb page, not just the map

list.title: create
list.description: The create function is the first step in map construction. t creates an svg container into which the various layers can be added.

list.title: dissolve
list.description: Transform multi part features into single parts feature

list.title: dodge
list.description: This function use d3.forceSimulation to spread dots or circles of given in a GeoJSON FeatureCollection (points). It returns the coordinates in the page map. It can be used to create a dorling cartogram

list.title: featurecollection
list.description: featurecollection is a function to create a valid GeoJSON FeatureCollection, from geometries, features or coordinates.

list.title: footer
list.description: The footer function allows add a source below the map

list.title: geotable
list.description: geotable is a function to create an array on objects containing properties and geomeytries, froam a GeoJSON FeatureCollection. This makes it easy to sort, extract data, etc. tool.featurecollection(geotable, { geometry: "geometry" }) can be used to rebuild a valid geoJSON.

list.title: graticule
list.description: The graticule function allows to create a layer with lat/long lines

list.title: halfcircle
list.description: The halfcircle function allows to create a layer with rotable half-circles from a geoJSON

list.title: header
list.description: The header function allows add a title above the map

list.title: height
list.description: This function return a function to calculate radius of circles from data

list.title: merge
list.description: merge is a function to join a geoJSON and a data file.

list.title: mushrooms
list.description: The circles_half function allows to add an legend for proportional half-circles

list.title: north
list.description: The north function allows add a North arrow.

list.title: outline
list.description: The outline function allows to create a layer with Earth outline in the projection

list.title: path
list.description: The path function generates SVG paths from a geoJSON

list.title: plot
list.description: The plot() function in geoviz allows you to call up all the layer types available in the library via a single function. To do this, you need to define the type in the parameter. For example: geoviz.plot({type: "graticule", step: 30})

list.title: proj4d3
list.description: proj4d3 is a function developped by Philippe Rivi√®re to allow tu use proj4js projections with d3. See https://observablehq.com/@fil/proj4js-d3

list.title: project
list.description: This function use geoproject from d3-geo-projection to project a geoJSON.

list.title: radialGradient
list.description: The radialGradient function allows to create a radialGradient

list.title: radius
list.description: This function return a function to calculate radius of circles from data

list.title: random
list.description: This function returns a random color

list.title: render
list.description: The render function returns the svg document

list.title: replicate
list.description: Data-driven features replication. This function can be used to create "dots cartograms"

list.title: rewind
list.description: Rewind a FeatureCollection counterclockwise and inner rings. Adapted from MapBox geojson-rewind code (https://github.com/mapbox/grojson-rewind) under ISC license

list.title: ridge
list.description: Calculate the centroid of all the geometries given in a GeoJSON FeatureCollection

list.title: scalebar
list.description: The scalebar function allows add a scalebar.

list.title: shadow
list.description: The shadow function allows to create a svg filter. It can be use ta add a shadow effect

list.title: spike
list.description: The spike function allows to create a layer with spikes from a geoJSON

list.title: spikes
list.description: The spikes function allows to add an legend for spike marks

list.title: text
list.description: The text function allows to add a text on the map. It allow also to create a layer with labels from a geoJSON

list.title: tile
list.description: The tile function allows to display raster tiles. To use this mark, you must use the projection d3.geoMercator()

list.title: type_choro
list.description: With the geoviz.plot({type = "choro", ...}) function, TEXT you can quickly draw a choroplethe map. The main arguments to use are :

list.title: typo
list.description: This function allows you to assign colors to qualitative data. It can be used to create typology maps.

list.title: typo_horizontal
list.description: The typo_horizontal function allows to add an horizontal legend on a map for typo layers

list.title: typo_vertical
list.description: The typo_vertical function allows to add an vertical legend on a map for typo layers

list.title: unproject
list.description: This function allow to unproject geometries.
